title.narrative: ZCCB's response to the OMICRON COVID-19 variant

description.narrative:
The world at large and Zambia in particular continues to experience the adverse effects of the COVID-19 pandemic on its social, economic and religious welfare. Zambia has experienced 3 waves of COVID since its first case in March 2020 and is now beginning to experience the fourth wave of COVID with the first cases of the OMICRON variant detected early December. The recent discovery of the new OMICRON variant of the virus has also come with its own challenges, with grave negative impact on human life and all the socio-economic and political structures. Therefore, concerted efforts are required in order to strike a fine balance between protecting the health of Zambians, minimizing economic and social disruption, and respecting human rights.
It is in view of the foregoing that the Zambia Conference of Catholic Bishops (ZCCB) through its Secretariat would like to contribute and supplement government efforts in the prevention against and dissemination of information about Covid-19; particularly concerning the vaccination exercise that was re-launched countrywide last November 2021
